candidates.title: release: 1.1.0
candidates.body: ## Release: 1.1.0

candidates.title: feat(audit): add report
candidates.body:
## Description

Add Halborn audit report

<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

Updates dependencies across the project and adds a Halborn audit report, including significant version upgrades for Solana, Anchor, and the ephemeral-rollups SDK.

- Updated Solana version from v2.1.11 to v2.1.21 in `.github/workflows/run-tests.yml`
- Changed `ephemeral-rollups-sdk` from git dependency to published crate v0.2.5 in `tests/integration/programs/test-delegation/Cargo.toml`
- Upgraded Anchor from 0.30.1 to 0.31.1 across package.json and Cargo.toml files
- Updated import paths from `ephemeral_rollups_sdk_v2` to `ephemeral_rollups_sdk` in `tests/integration/programs/test-delegation/src/lib.rs`



<!-- /greptile_comment -->

candidates.title: chore: upgrade solana to 2.2
candidates.body:
## Description

chore: upgrade solana to 2.2

| Status  | Type  | ⚠️ Core Change | Issue |
| :---: | :---: | :---: | :--: |
| Ready | Tooling | No | - |

<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

Updates Solana dependencies from version 2.1.11 to 2.2 across the delegation program, affecting core packages like solana-program and solana-sdk.

- Changed version constraints in `Cargo.toml` from `=2.1.11` to `2.2` for solana-program and solana-curve25519
- Updated solana-program-test and solana-sdk test dependencies to version 2.2
- Removed strict version pinning in favor of more flexible versioning
- No functional code changes required, purely dependency maintenance



<!-- /greptile_comment -->

## Problem

Outdated solana dependencies


## Solution

Upgraded all solana deps to 2.1.7



<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

This PR upgrades Solana dependencies to version 2.1.11 and implements necessary compatibility changes across the codebase, though there's a discrepancy in the PR description which mentions version 2.1.7.

- Updated Solana dependencies to v2.1.11 in `Cargo.toml` and GitHub workflow configuration
- Changed Solana CLI installation URL from release.solana.com to release.anza.xyz in `.github/workflows/run-tests.yml`
- Upgraded Rust toolchain to 1.84.1 in `rust-toolchain.toml`
- Added length checks in `src/state/utils/to_bytes.rs` and `try_from_bytes.rs` for improved buffer overflow protection
- Added clippy allow attribute in `src/lib.rs` for Solana-specific cfg attributes



<!-- /greptile_comment -->

candidates.title: feat: return Ok() on valid commit/finalize without failing
candidates.body:
## Description

Return Ok() on valid commit/finalize without failing

| Status  | Type  | ⚠️ Core Change | Issue |
| :---: | :---: | :---: | :--: |
| Ready | Feature/Refactor | No | - |

## Problem

Commit and Finalize instructions are typically bundled together. There are cases where the commit or finalize is discharged, e.g a most recent commitment landed or there is nothing to commit. These cases make the transaction fails, preventing all the other commits/finalizes to succeed.    

## Solution

We instead return Ok() without any modification in such cases, so that the other correct instructions can be processed.

## Other changes (e.g. bug fixes, small refactors)

- Small refactoring in the code and added `magicblock-` prefix to the crate
- Bump version to 1.0.0

## Issues

Closes #56 

<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

This PR improves transaction handling by allowing bundled commit/finalize instructions to continue when individual operations are validly skipped, rather than failing the entire transaction.

- Changed commit_state.rs to return Ok() with a log message for outdated slots instead of failing
- Reduced RENT_FEES_PERCENTAGE from 30% to 10% in consts.rs while maintaining PROTOCOL_FEES_PERCENTAGE at 10%
- Added `is_uninitialized_account` helper in loaders.rs to better handle skipped operations
- Modified finalize.rs to check for uninitialized accounts before proceeding with finalization
- Reordered fee distribution in undelegate.rs to prioritize validator fees over protocol fees



<!-- /greptile_comment -->

candidates.title: chore: check for state slot at commit time
candidates.body:
<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

This PR introduces state slot validation and improves error handling in the delegation program, with significant changes to PDA derivation and lamports settlement.

- Added new error variants in `src/error.rs` for handling outdated slots, undelegation states, and arithmetic overflow
- Replaced manual buffer PDA derivation with dedicated functions `delegate_buffer_pda_from_delegated_account_and_owner_program` and `undelegate_buffer_pda_from_delegated_account` in `src/pda.rs`
- Removed `lamports.rs` module and refactored lamports settlement logic directly into processor functions
- Added slot validation in `commit_state.rs` to prevent outdated commits and improved error handling
- Renamed fee-related constants for clarity (FEES_SESSION -> RENT_FEES_PERCENTAGE, FEES_VOLUME -> PROTOCOL_FEES_PERCENTAGE)



<!-- /greptile_comment -->

candidates.title: fix: remove allow undelegate attack vectors
candidates.body:
## Summary

As discussed, we found that valid_until and the IX "allow_undelegation" could allow a malicious program to steal state and lamports from the validators.

## Details

This PR removes all those capabilities from the delegation program. We keep the ABI intact however to make this a non-breaking change (only changing the program code, not the program's ABI)

<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

This PR removes time-based delegation controls and the 'AllowUndelegate' functionality to address potential security vulnerabilities in the delegation program's undelegation process.

- Removes `valid_until` field from `DelegateArgs` and `DelegationMetadata` structs, eliminating time-based delegation expiry
- Removes `AllowUndelegate` discriminator (value 4) and related functionality from instruction processing
- Replaces time-based undelegation checks with direct `is_undelegatable` flag validation in `src/processor/undelegate.rs`
- Updates error messages and tests to reflect removal of time-based validation
- Removes `src/instruction_builder/allow_undelegate.rs` and `tests/test_allow_undelegate.rs` completely



<!-- /greptile_comment -->

candidates.title: feat: Support delegation of on-curve accounts
candidates.body:
# feat: Support delegation/undelegation of on-curve accounts

| Status  | Type  | ⚠️ Core Change | Issue |
| :---: | :---: | :---: | :--: |
| Ready | Feature  | Yes | #37  |

## Problem

Support delegation of on-curve accounts. See #37 

## Issues

Closes #37

<!-- greptile_comment -->

## Greptile Summary

This pull request introduces support for delegating on-curve accounts in the delegation program, addressing issue #37. The changes enhance the flexibility of the delegation system by allowing direct delegation of on-curve accounts without requiring a wrapper program.

Key changes include:
- Added `delegate_on_curve` function in `src/instruction.rs` for on-curve account delegation
- Modified `process_delegate` in `src/processor/delegate.rs` to handle both on-curve and off-curve accounts
- Introduced `DelegationMetadata` struct to store additional delegation information
- Added new test file `tests/test_delegate_on_curve.rs` to verify on-curve account delegation
- Updated existing tests to reflect the new delegation process

These changes significantly expand the program's capabilities, allowing for more versatile account delegation scenarios.

<!-- /greptile_comment -->

candidates.title: feat: minimal rust delegate SDK
candidates.body:
## Summary

Initial minimal Rust SDK for account delegation.

## Details

We don't have a Rust SDK at all at this point so here I added the minimum to make this somewhat
ergonomic to use.

With the added methods I can do the following to get the correctly initialized account metas
to include in the accounts sent to the wrapper instruction.

```rs
let (pda, _) = pda_and_bump(&player);

let delegate_accounts = DelegateAccounts::new(pda, program_id);
let delegate_metas = DelegateAccountMetas::from(delegate_accounts);
let account_metas = vec![
    AccountMeta::new(player, true),
    delegate_metas.delegate_account,
    delegate_metas.owner_program,
    delegate_metas.buffer,
    delegate_metas.delegation_record,
    delegate_metas.delegation_metadata,
    delegate_metas.delegation_program,
    delegate_metas.system_program,
];
```

## Remaining

The PDA derivation and `consts` have been copied for now with a note that we need to either
move those into a core module or have the program use them via the sdk.

candidates.title: Feat/add allow undelegation through cpi
candidates.body:
# Add allow undelegation through cpi

| Status  | Type  | ⚠️ Core Change | Issue |
| :---: | :---: | :---: | :--: |
| Ready | Feature | Yes | - |

## Problem

- Previously it was impossible to control trough the delegating program when undelegation is allowed. 

## Solution

- Added an `is_undelegatable` that needs to be set trough CPI by the owner program


## Other changes (e.g. bug fixes, small refactors)

- Restructured delegation record PDA to hold less data and created a delegation metadata PDA borsh serialized to store delegation validity & is_undelegatable flag

candidates.title: :sparkles: Allow undelegation if no commitment exists
candidates.body:
# :sparkles: Allow undelegation if no commitment exists

| Status  | Type  | ⚠️ Core Change | Issue |
| :---: | :---: | :---: | :--: |
| Ready | Feature/Hotfix | Yes | - |

## Problem

The current implementation of the Ephemeral Rollups commits and finalizes in a single atomic transaction. The undelegation was only allowing the change of owner upon finalizing a committed state. This made it impossible to undelegate with the current implementation.

## Solution

Allow undelegation if there is no committed state.

## Notes

To be revised once the commit/finalize process is split for implementing the fraud proof mechanism.

# :sparkles: Store delegated account seeds

| Status  | Type  | ⚠️ Core Change | Issue |
| :---: | :---: | :---: | :--: |
| Ready | Feature | Yes | - |

## Description

- This allow to undelegate without the need to explicitly hardcode the seeds 
- Seeds are stored in a pda at delegation time, so that the account can be closed and reopened with the original data

## Other changes
- Refactoring & removed Shank dependency

candidates.title: :sparkles: Delegate in a single instruction & Refactor
candidates.body:
# Delegate in a single instruction & Refactor

- Update delegate instruction to be executed in a single transaction
- We no longer need a separate buffer account, the "original" data is now hold in the same PDA (with owner set to the delegation program), until it's undelegated and some proposed state_diff finalized
- Add integration tests, with an external Bolt program using the delegation program
- Add update_frequency_ms in the delegation record pda
